intro: Crepidium benguetense, commonly known as the Benguet orchid, is a rare and endemic orchid species found in the Philippines. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its intricate floral structure and delicate appearance. The plant typically grows in montane forest habitats, where it thrives in shaded, moist environments. Its flowers are usually small, with a complex arrangement of petals and sepals, and it produces a unique, fragrant scent. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
